thread.title: NHL: Canucks beat Ducks in shootout
thread.title_full: NHL: Canucks beat Ducks in shootout

author: Associated Press
title: NHL: Canucks beat Ducks in shootout
text: NHL: Canucks beat Ducks in shootout Associated Press Posted: 10/12/2015 09:58:30 PM PDT Updated: 10/12/2015 10:19:05 PM PDT Monday's HIGHLIGHTS Canucks 2, Ducks 1: Radim Vrbata and Alex Burrows scored in the shootout, and Vancouver spoiled Anaheim's home opener. The Ducks failed to score on a power play during their first taste of 3-on-3 overtime hockey. Lightning 6, Bruins 3: Brian Boyle scored two goals, and Steven Stamkos had a tiebreaking power-play goal for Tampa Bay. Boston is 0-3 for the first time since 1999. Islanders 4, Jets 2: John Tavares had a power-play goal and two assists, and Thomas Greiss made 22 saves to lift New York. Sabres 4, Blue Jackets 2: Rookie Jack Eichel scored a hustling, unassisted goal to spark Buffalo. Flyers 1, Panthers 0: Brayden Schenn scored, and Michael Neuvirth stopped 31 shots for Philadelphia. Blues: Rookie Robby Fabbri is out indefinitely with a concussion. Fabbri was injured Saturday during a loss to Minnesota. Kings: Forward Dwight King will miss at least two months after having surgery on a broken foot. He was hurt during the Kings' final exhibition. Wild: Assistant coach Darryl Sydor was sentenced to 60 days in jail after pleading guilty to driving drunk. Sydor will be allowed to serve his jail time in installments over four years. -- ASSOCIATED PRESS
